intro: Nonea stenosolen, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed nonea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers, which attract native pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
